title: Allison Theobold
text:
I am always interested in talking about

researching how students collaborate in-class
fostering students’ identity as a statistician
data feminism
alternative ways to assess students’ learning
R-Ladies
RainbowR
Disney Land

over coffee

title: Allison Theobold
text:
Professional Honors & Awards
Allison was selected as the 2022 American Statistical Association’s Pride Scholarship recipient. Allison was also selected as an ASA StatsForward Fellow for the inagural 2024 cohort.
Allison has contributed to integrating equity into the statistics education by being part of the GAISE revision committee, and the Bill & Melinda Gates Statistics High School Pathways curricular team.

title: atheobold.github.io
text: Hi there! I’m Allison Theobold. I’m an Assistant Professor in the Department of Statistics at Cal Poly in San Luis Obispo, California. I love teaching any and all computing courses, especially our first computing course. I love R with all my heart, but am currently learning to like Python. As a researcher, I focus on ways whe can innovate our statistics and data science classrooms to be more equitable and inclusive of a diverse body of learners. Outside of work, you can find me running and biking on the trails in San Luis Obispo, watching women’s basketball, cooking, and enjoying a good cup of coffee.
